alert.note: Alert for Clay; Parke; Putnam; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:48AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Vigo, north central Clay, southeastern Parke and southwestern Putnam Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 748 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Brazil, or 14 miles northeast of Terre Haute, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Vigo, north central Clay, southeastern Parke and southwestern Putnam Counties, including the following locations... Bridgeton, Reelsville, Lena, Cloverdale, Carbon, Rosedale, and Harmony. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 34 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
